item.title: The Maduro Raid Was a Strategic Victory and a Tactical Success
item.description: Maduro’s fall presents the communist Chinese with a comprehensive embarrassment.

item.title: In Venezuela, the Era of Escaping Consequences Is Over
item.description: In the wake of the narco-regime’s takedown, five lessons emerge — for the region, for the U.S., and for the world.

item.title: The Case Against State Involvement in a Warner Bros. Deal
item.description: The threat to the modern media landscape isn’t Netflix or Paramount — it’s regulation that protects incumbents and strangles competition.

item.title: Sometimes, Girls Just Want to Sing
item.description: Let art speak for itself, and leave the partisan flags behind.

item.title: Twenty Films Worth Leaving the House for in 2026
item.description: This looks like the strongest year for cinema since before the plague.
